inn1.comm: loosener outside off, Gayle doesn't bother chasing that
nippy, gets a bit of zip off the patch, lands short of a good length outside off, surprises Gayle with the bounce as he tries to prod off the back foot, is beaten
decent start, caught playing forward this time, in the channel outside off and going away with the angle, a bit of movement away from the bat as Gayle tries to defend off the front foot
three in a row, a lazy lunge forward and is beaten by the away movement, Anderson will be encouraged by this
on the stumps, good length on middle and leg, defended to short cover, sarcastic cheers from the crowd
back of a length on middle, defended with an angled bat towards point, much more confident this time but Anderson has begun well
probing line outside off, he lets it go, bowled at a decent pace there, not a loosener like Anderson's last over
on target rightaway, back of a length on the off stump, defended solidly to cover
fuller but in that channel outside off, Simmons is taking no risks early on, leaves it alone
shuffles to work it away behind square but gets rapped high on the pads, would have gone well above the stumps
good stuff from Broad, slightly short outside off, gets a good carry through to the keeper
first runs for Phil's nephew, good length outside off, held its line there, guided down to third man for a single
defended awkwardly there, short of a length outside off, dabs it back uppishly towards the bowler with a comical jump
beaten, none of those acrobatics this time, landed on a good length outside off and spat away as he tried to defend off the back foot
too straight and Simmons makes good use, turning it away between midwicket and mid-on for a couple
pretends to withdraw his bat, but he's actually beaten, in that channel outside off  stump and is almost done in by the swing once again
a touch too short and wide, guided comfortably to point, still a little tentative there, a settled batsman would have given it a good thumping
short of a good length on the off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot, and Andy completes another good over
back of a length on the off stump, blocked towards cover
that's disappeared, Gayle's opened up,  poor ball though, long hop on the off stump and he picks the length early, rocking back and pulling it away over the deep-midwicket boundary

appeal for lbw, full and swinging in towards leg stump, Gayle's missed the attempted flick and is rapped right in front of the stumps, the umpire though shakes his head, poor call really, would have gone straight on, Broad unlucky. Steve Davis is the umpire
good length on the off stump, defended off the front foot to cover
tries to pull but mistimes it to midwicket, similar ball to the one that went into the stands but Gayle fails to cash in this time
not this time though, full on the off stump and he hits through the line past the bowler and mid-off for a boundary, eventful over that
moves well outside off to a ball that's bowled on middle, gets behind it and turns it away wide of square leg, beautifully timed, raced away to the fence
short of a good length on the off stump, the comical jumping defense again, but struck a little more firmly to cover
in the corridor , gets across and blocks it in front of cover
held it back, short of a length on the off stump, defended off the back foot to the bowler
massive six, just a fraction short outside off, he latches onto it in a flash, heaving it over the deep-midwicket boundary, about ten rows into the crowd
much better from Anderson, testing line outside off stump but Simmons restrains himself this time, shoulders arms to that one

typical of Gayle, greets him with a six, a meaty length ball outside off and that's got to go, hits across the line but connects it superbly, sails into the crowd for his second six, the West Indies are away
good length outside off stump, leaves it alone though you never know with this guy, would have swatted that as if it were a fly when in full flow
shapes himself for a monstrous cut through point but fails to reach it, a touch too wide
slightly short of a good length outside off, left alone again, it's three he's not got his bat to
leaves it be once more, better stuff from Flintoff, in that tempting zone outside the off stump but Gayle's taking no risks there
and again, good comeback after that horrific start, left alone to the keeper
fullish outside off, walks across again but covers it well, flicks it behind square for a couple
confidently driven to mid-off, slightly overpitched outside off stump
and again, teasing length that but Simmons deals with it well, getting forward to the pitch and driving through the line to mid-off
short of a good length on the off stump, runs it down elegantly to third man for a single
good length on the off stump, defended watchfully towards cover off the back foot
poor line there, bowled short on the leg stump and Gayle tickles it to the fine-leg boundary, sad end to what was otherwise a decent over
full on the off stump, tries to drive it back past the bowler, gets a thick inside edge towards midwicket
delightful drive on the up but straight to short cover, a tad too full from Freddie
cut away fiercely, just a fraction short outside off, makes room and slashes it away behind point
on target, good length on the off stump and gets some decent bounce, punched off the back foot to cover
quicker and short on the off stump, goes for the pull through midwicket, gets an inside edge onto his shoe and it drops dead on the pitch
well played, full outside off, gets to the pitch and pushes it firmly wide of mid-off for a single
starts with a slower one pitched short outside off, Simmons was too early into an attempted nudge behind square, misses
short of a length again, bowled at normal pace, shoulders arms to that one
needs to get fuller, easily done that, run down to third man to give Gayle the strike
he's a little generous on Harmy as compared to Flintoff, he's fed with a half-volley outside off, military medium really, driven stylishly wide of Anderson at mid-off for a boundary
identical shot but not timed as well, gets a single for his efforts, Anderson slides and saves a couple
better, much  closer to the off stump and bowled on a good length, defended to cover, not the best over he's bowled

slashes hard at a wide one from Flintoff, gets a thick outside edge and it flies away over third man, no chance for Harmison there, who wasn't at the edge as he should have been, but it would have cleared him anyway
almost chopped it on, tries to defend that lethargically off the back foot, gets an inside edge onto his back pad
too close to cut but he goes through with the shot anyway, chops it down to point
fullish outside off and moving away a hint, left alone to the keeper
good length on the off stump, tries to defend that on the back foot in front of cover plays it with soft hands and the ball rolls down to third man off the outside edge
overpitched but gets away, driven straight to Anderson at short cover
not a bad ball really, bowled on a good length on middle but Gayle is in prime form and he dispatches it over the long-on boundary, reached forward gave it some beating
watchfully defended to cover this time, a similar delivery but plays it with more respect
pushed gently wide of cover for a quick single
Harmison's struggling here, full and wide, Simmons makes room and square-drives it wide of point, played at it hard and was well in control
back of a length outside off, could have treated that the same way if he wanted to, but chooses to let it go
better, full outside off, defended cautiously to cover
short and wide, there to cut ,goes for it, misses and point can breathe easy
similar delivery and chops it in front of point this time, straight to cover who's at the edge of the circle, wise boy
short of a good length on the off stump, dabbed to short cover
held it back, on the off stump, gets back and defends towards cover again
good running, drops it on the off side and scampers down for a quick single, Simmons responds well
good length on the off stump, gets forward and pushes it to point, looking good, Phil's nephew
low full toss on leg stump, defended to midwicket, surprisingly, was a hit-me ball that
tries to compensate for that unforgivable sin by trying to heave this short ball over midwicket, misses
well he's made up for it now, juicy half-volley outside off and Gayle punishes that into the crowd over long-off
wicket, finally! Short of a good length on the off stump and he tries to bludgeon that into the stands over midwicket, gets the top edge and Matt Prior judges it well running to his left.
full outside off, driven elegantly but straight to short cover, presented the full face there, confidently played
back of a length on the off stump, defended to cover
shot of the day for me, but just a couple, full on the off stump and he plays a Laxman-like flick wristily wide of midwicket for a couple, pure, sub-continental stuff
short of a good length on the off stump, tries to defend it towards cover, hits the bottom of the bat and rolls over towards midwicket
short of a good length on the off stump, pushed to cover off the back foot
banged in short on the off stump, played with an angled bat to point

run out, Sarwan must take the blame there, short on middle, turned away into the vacant square-leg region, they take an easy single and Sarwan calls for the second, Simmons is halfway down the pitch only to see his partner back away at the last moment, Mascarenhas returns an accurate throw to the keeper who clips off the bails to find him well short
full outside off, driven wide of mid-off for a couple, he's off
back of a length on the off stump, defended to point
full outside off, driven through the line to mid-off
held it back, slightly short on the off, punched to cover
good bowling here, on the stumps this time, pushed off the back foot to the bowler
good length on the off stump, pushed back to Broad, five dot balls
concedes a run but has bowled well, slower ball bowled short outside off, run down to third man
short of a length outside off, Sarwan goes for the cut, gets a thick edge and Anderson running to his left from third makes a mess of it, Flintoff isn't happy, who would be
in the channel outside off, pushed to cover off the back foot
driven firmly but straight to mid-off, full and wide, played through the line
back of a length on the off stump, pushed off the back foot to midwicket
chopped it on! Fraction short on the off stump, tried to guide it to third man, got the inside edge and the sticks behind him take a beating! England have clawed back well here
full toss on leg stump, starts off well, poor stuff from Freddie after earning that wicket, driven through midwicket for a boundary
back of a length on the off stump, pushed wide of  point
cut away hard but straight to third man, short and wide
slower ball bowled on a good length outside off and cut back in, Chanderpaul shoulders arms to that one
held it back, pitched it short outside off, guided off the back foot to point
short on middle and off, pulled away behind square a little wide of fine-leg for a couple
short of a good length outside off, slower one again, a legcutter, wide enough for Chanders to let go
he's bowling well below normal pace here, short of a length outside off, chopped down to third man
slower ball bowled on a good length on middle and off, turned away in front of square for a single
full on the off stump, drives it stylishly through the covers for a single
back of a length on the off stump, pushed behind point for a single
slower ball bowled short on the off stump, tries to make room and guide it to third man, drops it towards point instead
bouncer on middle and he mistimes a hook behind square, got the top-edge but it landed safely
brutal! Short and wide, Broad, who's done a good job until now errs in length, Ramdin cuts it away through the narrow gap between point and cover
the fielder's been pushed back, full and wide, square-driven towards deep cover
slower ball bowled full on the off stump, pushed wide of midwicket for a single
pushed him back there, on middle, turned away towards fine leg, calls for the second but Anderson is alert in the deep, rockets in a good throw to Prior to keep the batsmen to one
slower ball bowled short on the off stump, harmless really, pulled in front of midwicket for a single
Ramdin's looking aggressive, almost holed out in the deep there, short on middle and was tempted into the pull, fortunately for him, he mistimed it and it fell yards short of deep square leg
acrobatic fielding from Anderson at point, all for saving a single, dabbed wide of him and he pulls off a circus-like dive to his left
back of a length on middle, dropped into the leg side for a quick one
back of a length on middle, pushed wide of midwicket
short on middle, mistimes a pull straight to midwicket
back of a length on the off stump, stands tall and defends back to the bowler
almost pulled off a Sarwan there, short on the off stump, tries to run it down to third man, gets an under-edge just wide of the off stump towards the keeper
good length on middle and leg, tucked away behind square for a single
short on middle and off, pushed into the leg side towards midwicket
back of a length on middle and leg, worked away behind square for a single
fullish on the off stump, pushed through the line to mid-off
slower ball on middle, defended to point off the front foot
on middle and leg, driven down the ground to long-on for a single
short of a good length outside off, chopped down to point
gets back and punches it in front of cover, why aren't they bowling fuller?
fullish outside off, he's listening, or reading rather, whatever, eased through the covers for a single
on middle and off, tempting line again, pushed back to Harmy
things have certainly slowed down, back of a length on the off stump, dabbed to point
slower ball bowled on a good length on the off stump, flicked wide of midwicket for a single

appeal for run out, Ramdin has just made it back, driven to mid-off, Chanderpaul calls for the single but sends Ramdin back, he's backed up too far but despite an accurate throw - it's a direct hit - from Flintoff, he's made it back comfortably, the striker at fault, again
slightly shorter outside off, guided to third man for a single
short and wide, fails to cash in, chopped to point
well played, waited for it, landed on a good length on middle, got back and flicked away behind square, between deep square leg and fine leg, for a couple
paddled fine, enterprising stuff, full on the off stump, he bends down and plays it well wide of fine leg, my richly deserved applause to anyone who guesses who it was who invented that stroke.
back of a length on the off stump, defended off the front foot to cover
short of a good length on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
fullish on the off stump, driven through the line wide of cover for a single
short on leg stump, helped on its way to fine leg
back of a length outside off, Chanders lets it go this time
edged and just wide of the widish slip, wouldn't have carried, pushed at it hard, rolls down to third man
good length on the off stump, gets forward and pushes it back to the bowler
full, driven off the front foot to mid-off
short of a good length on the off stump, pushed to cover
fullish outside off, gets across, closes the face and turns it away towards deep square leg
back of a length on the off stump, pushed off the back foot to short cover
goes for the paddle again, who was it who invented that stroke? Misses though, and Prior gets a good rap on his chest
tossed up on the off stump, guided to point, decides against the single
flighted on leg stump, turned away to square leg
thrown up on the off again, driven straight to short cover
good stuff, kept him on a leash this over, on middle and leg, pushed into the leg side
quicker through the air, on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
on middle and leg, turned away wide of midwicket for a single
fullish on leg stump, pushed wide of midwicket for  quick single., Ramdin responds well and dives full length to make it back

horrendous shot, that! Not even to the pitch, bowled on a good length on the off stump, went for a massive heave over midwicket, ended up slicing it and Flintoff at mid-on ran a few steps back to complete a well-judged catch. West Indies clearly on the back foot now
slightly short on middle and off, dropped into the off side
fullish outside off, pushed to short cover
defended off the front foot to the bowler
tossed up on middle and off, pushed through the covers for a single
fullish on the off stump, defended off the front foot to short cover
slightly short on middle and leg, turned away off the back foot behind square for a single
full on middle and off, driven off the front foot through the covers for a single
clipped off his pads, played wide of midwicket for a run
back of a length on the off stump, defended off the back foot to cover
fullish on middle and off, closes the face to defend it on the leg side, gets a leading edge towards the bowler
back of a length on the off, turned wide of midwicket for a single
short again but plays it with a straight bat back to the bowler
runs not that easy to come by now, straight on middle, pushed through the midwicket region for a couple
overpitched on the off stump, eased through to long-off
starts off with a long hop on middle, pulled away in front of square for a single
banged in short on middle, defended with a straight bat back to the bowler
short of a length on middle, gets back, closes the face and dabs it wide of square leg
poor ball but treated leniently, short and wide, cut away straight to the point fielder, not much intent in that shot, was more a defensive stroke
short on leg stump, is struck on the gloves as he tries to whip it off his hips, lobs into the leg side
good length on leg stump and as my colleauge Will Luke would say, nurdled into the leg side
stump-to-stump, on the off, defended solidly onto the poor pitch
short of a good length outside off, played with an angled bat down to third man, the boundaries have dried up and there's a slight drizzle in Barbados
offcutter that didn't cut but bowled really slow through the air, Chanders played early and was struck on the thigh
good length on middle and leg, defended back to the bowler
short of a length outside off, slapped wide of the bowler for a single
short and wide, cut away towards deep point
Anderson strays down the leg side, the first wide of the day
back of a length on middle, defended onto the pitch
down the leg side again, the second extra of the day, what a crime, wide again
on target, on a good length on the off stump, defended solidly towards cover

short of a good length on the off stump, keeps a little low but he handles it well. gets back, closes the face, and turns it to deep square leg for a fantabulous single, ok, let me get back to my senses now
banged in slightly short on the off stump, guided off the back foot to point
easily done, a hint of away movement but Chanders moves across and dabs it down to third man
in the channel outside off and came in with the angle, driven on the up towards cover
short of a good length outside off, chopped down to point
massive blow! Persisted with that irritating line just outside off, Chanderpaul tried to nudge that down to third man, got a thin edge and Prior made no mistake. England on top!
fullish on the off stump, defended with a lunge to cover
short of a lengh on the off stump, punched to cover again
came in a touch, pushed back to Mascarenhas
on middle and off, defended towards cover and calls for a single, is sent back wisely, Mascarenhas completes a successful over
short of a good length on the off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
shortish again on middle, dropped dead on the pitch
cutting line outside off, dropped down to point, tried to run it down but didnt get the direction right
fuller on the off stump, gets forward and defends it between  point and cover
back of a length outside off, angled wide of point for a quick single
swinging in, getting it to move around a bit, on middle, defended back to the bowler, runs have dried up
fullish on the off stump, eased wide of cover, but can't squeeze the single
he's been kept frustrated there, finally unleashes a corss-batted swing over midwicket, gets away with it, a single to deep midwicket
short of a good length on the off stump, pushed to midwicket

excellent catch by Flintoff, but he seems to have touched the ropes! The runs were difficult to come by, Pollard's eyes lit up after he saw that ball pitched up on the off stump, had a wild swing at it, didnt get hold of it and Flintoff at deep midwicket took it above his head with a leap and it just looked, seeing the replays, as if his left foot had just nudged the ropes on his way down. There was definitely some movement, the umpires, though, have given it out
good length on the off stump, defended to cover
fullish on and outside off, pushed into the off side
short of a good length on the off, pushed wide of point for a single
banged in short on middle, pulled away into the vacant zone wide of square leg
bouncer banged in on the off stump, ducks under it comfortably
back of a length on middle and off, defended into the leg side
short of a good length on the off, pushed off the back foot to cover
slightly short on middle, punched wide of mid-on for a quick single
angling down leg, tries to drive it wide of midwicket, is struck on the thighs
slower ball bowled full on the off stump, defended to cover
good length on middle and leg, drives it through the line to mid-on
short of a length on the off, stands tall and punches it towards mid-off
greeted with a boundary, length ball on middle, picked the length early, clipped it over midwicket for a boundary, a much-needed one, also a pressure-relieving one
goes for a cross-batted heave over midwicket again, a blind hit that, nowhere near it, is lucky that he managed an inside edge onto his pads
beautifully done this time, slower ball bowled full on middle, he picked it and drive it wirsitly wide of mid-on, raced off the bat
turned away off the back foot wide of fine leg and he rushes back for the second, a moment of anxiety, made known by a stinging shriek from the crowd, but he's made it back easily
wristy again, full on middle, turned away to fine leg for a single
better stuff from Harmy, in the channel outside off, left alone to the keeper
short of a good length on the off, defended to cover, Masca into his last over
full on middle, driven to long-on for a single
turned away into the leg side off the back foot
flicked away to deep square leg where Flintoff keeps them to a single
short of a good length on the off stump, defended into the off side
back of a length on middle, pushed towards midwicket, end of an excellent spell from Masca
short of a good length outside off, cut away to deep cover
short on the off stump, whipped away to deep midwicket
shortish again, punched to deep cover
slower ball outside off, short again, left alone to the keeper
offcutter that did cut back in, too close to late-cut which is what Bravo tried to do but misses,
slower one again, goes for a mighty pull into the stands, the ball ends up landing inside the circle and rolls down to deep square leg, salvages a single for that effort
Doesn't matter for Bravo who picks this full one on the off stump and lofts it cleanly over mid-off for a one-bounce four
shot back in, did a good job defending it dabbed into the off side wide of cover
came back in again, pushed off the back foot to long-on
timber! Bowled at 84.6 mph, a hint of inward movement, landed on a good length on the off stump, pushed Sammy back, kept a little low, broke through his defenses to crash into off and middle
bouncer outside off stump, Miller backs away
jagged back in again, but played well, pushed back to the bowler
full on the off stump, tries to clear mid-on, just about manages to do it, Shah runs back but fails to reach it
short of a length outside off, upper-cuts it to third man
attempted yorker on middle, almost pulls it off, Bravo is already into his shot but manages to catch the bottom of the bat to help dig it out
poor ball, what a horrific follow-up to that beauty the previous delivery, full toss down the leg side, Bravo misses the glance, Prior fails to reach it, the Windies get five wides
dropped, well that's a tough one, full toss on the off stump, smashed back towards Flintoff who dives low to his left but fails to hold on, nine out of ten bowlers would have put that down
full on middle and leg, clipped wide of midwicket for  a quick single
shot! Full and wide, Miller makes room and steers that uppishly wide of point, it beat third man to the boundary

Outstanding stuff, attempted slower ball gone bad, ends up being a beamer targeting the helmet - totally unitended of course - Bravo has a mighty swing at it, gets the top-edge and it sails over fine leg for a six, it's called a no-ball, rightly so
short of a length outside off, tries to murdier it past point, misses
runs coming freely now, short on middle and leg, seized the length early, pulled it away well wide of deep square leg for a one bounce four
yorker length on the off stump, driven wide of cover for a single
good length on middle and off, turned away off the front foot behind square for a single
full on the off stump, tries to loft it over midwicket, gets an inside edge onto his pads
short of a good length on leg stump, turned to square leg
no-ball, a front-foot no-ball, so there's a freehit coming, full toss on the off stump, struck to mid-off
caught by Strauss! On middle and off, tries to slog it over midwicket, gets a leading edge to cover where Strauss saves a single
full and wide, in the slot, goes for it, tries to clear extra cover, misses
beaten this time, good length outside off, tries to run it down to third man, misses
short of a good length on the off stump, dropped into the off side between cover and point for a single to get Bravo on strike
yorker length on the off stump, Bravo had shaped himself for a massive strike down the ground, checked his shot at the last moment defending it to mid-off
full on middle, flicked away to midwicket and rushes through for a single, keeps the strike, but that was an excellent over from Freddie
low full toss on the off stump, turned to midwicket
another low full toss and dealt with well, swings it away over midwicket for a boundary that also brings up his half-century, well done Bravo
into the crowd, a massive hit, length ball on the off stump and he gets stuck into it, gets under it nicely and smashes it well over deep midwicket for a mighty six
full outside off, eased through to deep cover for a single
well bowled, yorker length on middle and leg, dug out back to the bowler
beaten, fullish outside off, comes in just as Fidel tries to withdraw from the stroke
low full toss on the off stump, attempted yorker gone wrong, Bravo chips it over mid-on, a superb contribution this
shot of the day, full on middle, makes room and plays a trademark drive through mid-off and cover, presented the full face there, played from the crease and it speeds off to the fence
good ball, in the blockhole on middle, dug out into the off side
fullish on middle stump, chipped towards mid-on for a quick single
back of a length outside off, almost a bouncer, Edwards backs away
superb inswinging yorker on middle, negotiated well though, dug out to mid-on
good length outside off stump, gets back and tries to drive it past point, fails to reach it though
fullish on the off stump, plays a flowing drive but straight to deep cover
inswinging yorker again, this guy's a good blocker, the Tests showed that, but he's got to get some runs here, dug out into the off side
bouncer banged in outside off, goes for a comical hook behind square, misses

gone, deceived by the slower one, bowled full outside off, instead of giving his partner the strike he chips this one straight o Collingwood at long-off, Bravo stranded with the last man now, Fidel's no hitter
gets the single, bowled full on the off stump, bunts it to long-on for a single to keep the strike
slower ball bowled short on the off stump, tries to dispatch that into the stands over midwicket, misses

gone, identical delivery, attempts an identical shot, connects it this time, but not well enough, finds the substitute fielder Ian Bell who snaps it comfortably at deep midwicket, the end of a valuable innings
on middle and leg, turned away into the leg side behind square for a single
good length on the off stump and nipped back in, pushed towards Harmison at point and they scamper a single
back of a length on the off stump, pushed back to the bowler
short of a length on the off stump, guided wide of point for a quick single, shy at the non-striker's end but misses
full outside off, makes room to steer that past point, fails to connect
low full toss on the off stump, swung away from the left hander, pushed it back to Anderson
slower offcutter bowled short on the off stump, defended off the back foot onto the pitch
yorker length on middle, dug out short of cover for a quick single
fullish outside off, hangs his bat out, runs it down to third man for a single
slower ball bowled short on middle, tries to pull it away over midwicket, predictably misses, another dot ball
good length outside off, tries to nudge it into the off side, misses
short of a length on the off stump, dropped short of cover for a single
round the wicket, was in the slot, length ball outside off, swung at it wildly, tried to clear long-on, nowhere near it
very fortunate, short of a good length on the off stump, tries to close the face and dab it into the leg side, gets a thick outside edge that beats third man
and again, agony for Broad, pitched up on the off stump, tries to heave it over midwicket, flies off the outside edge in the same direction and third man had no chance
full outside off, tries his luck again, looks to swing it over midwicket, silently hoping it kisses the outside edge again, misses

inn2.comm: starts off with a wide down the leg side, Strauss tries to nudge it down, misses, but England are off the mark
fuller, good length on the off stump, driven through the line to mid-off
back of a length outside off, guided off the back foot to third man for a single
good length on middle and off, dropped into the leg side short of mid-on for a quick single
short on middle, is surprised by the bounce, tries to help it on its way to fine leg, does so but with some difficulty, ends up doing uppishly while trying to protect himself from the bounce
easily done, straight on middle, dabbed into the leg side for a quick run
short of a length outside off, cut away towards a diving point who gets his hands on it to keep the batsmen down to a single
short outside off, good bounce there, tries to upper cut that over the keeper, misses
short of a good length outside off, guided to third man for a single
down the leg side, false start, given a wide again
short of a good length on middle and off, pushed wide of midwicket for a single, Bopara is doing this well
to straight, on middle, easy for Strauss who waits for it and turns it away behind square for a single
full on middle and leg, glanced down to fine leg for a single
shot! Just a fraction short outside off but Strauss is in control, gets back and cuts away wide of a diving cover, it was slightly uppish, to the boundary
quick single, on middle and off, pushed towards mid-off and they scamper through for a run, Bopara gets to the non-striker's end in time, thanks to a full reach
too full and Strauss cashes in, drives it over, just over, cover for a boundary. Not that there was a chance, that was powerfully struck
poor ball, fed him with a short and wide ball there, begging to be hit and Strauss obligies, cutting it away fiercely wide of a diving point
three in a row, good attacking batting and some horrendous bowling, long hop outside off, Strauss gets back and pulls it away over midwicket

Baker is being punished here, did nothing wrong this ball, short on the off stump, not much room to cut, but Strauss is in some form today, stays his ground and upper-cuts it over the slips for a boundary. He's given England the ideal start here
and keeps the strike, sensibly taking a single off the last ball, eased through the off side towards deep cover
good length outside off, hangs his bat out, gets the outside edge, all along the ground towards third man
back of a length outside off, punched wide of point for a single, Baker at third man rockets in a powerful throw to prevent the second
tries the upper-cut again, bowled at 90 mph, short and wide though and Strauss fails to take advantage this time
poor ball, short on the leg stump, Strauss has no trouble helping it on its way to the fine-leg boundary, just a paddle and that's sped away
fullish on middle and leg, flicked away behind square for a single
good length on middle, tucked away behind Bravo at square leg for a single, thinks of a second but the fielder recovers well
slower ball bowled on a good length outside off, that's his prime variation, Bopara tries to push it into the off side, is late into it
wide, too short and way out of the batsman's reach, poor start
short again but much closer to the off stump, chops it down towards third man
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man for a single
continuing to bowl short and keeps on leaking runs, short and wide, cut away behind point, deep cover runs to his left, cuts it off, but the batsmen have taken two
much fuller, good length on the off stump, defended wide of point for a single
straying on the pads but there's cover, tickled to short fine for a single
starts off bowling full on the off stump, wristily flicked away towards deep midwicket
full on middle, driven firmly down the ground, a diving effort from Nikita Miller saves a couple of runs but they get a single
slower ball bowled full outside off, gets forward and square-drives it wide of point, deep cover cuts it off but they've taken two
full outside off, driven on the up to short cover where Gayle fields
goodish length a touch too wide outside off, opens the face to play it down to third man
similar delivery, identical result, much closer to the off stump but Bopara handles it  well, waits for it and plays with an angled bat at the last moment to guide it to third man

good length on the off stump, driven through the line past the bowler towards mid-off and rushes through for a comfortable single in the end, a lot of oohs and aahs from the crowd but this guy is quick
slower ball bowled on a good length on leg stump, dropped into the leg side for another easily taken single
tries a Straussean upper cut but unlike his mentor, misses, on the body, didn't make enough room to execute that properly
full on middle, turns it away between midwicket and square leg for a single, rightly gives Strauss the strike
Bopara will be smiling, now Strauss misses the upper cut, there was enough room but it probably bounced more than he expected
slower ball bowled slightly short outside off, reaches for it to cut it wide of point, misses
on target, good length on middle and off, driven to midwicket
dot ball, that's four in a row, on middle stump, held its line, pushed back to the bowler
drilled down the ground but straight to long-off, overpitched but there's cover in the deep
full outside off stump, driven straight to Bravo at cover, a bump ball and has the crowd excited for a second, they know it too but still have a reason to yell out, wonder why
slower ball bowled on a good length on the off, dropped short of point and steal an easy single
banged in short on middle, tries to hook it behind square, gets the top edge but it lands well short of fine leg
military medium down the leg side, only just, should have been given a wide, but Bucknor is a generous man in his final ODI
good length on the off stump, defended off the front foot to cover
short of a good length outside off, cut away to third man for a single

appeal for caught-behind, edged and Ramdin thinks he's snapped it, the West Indians are celebrating, short of a good length outside off, prods at it , there's a clear edge and replays suggest this may take some time to decide. Did he get his gloves under the ball while diving to his left? It's been referred to the third umpire, who says the batsman's safe. Too close to call there, it was neck and neck but my hunch is he may have just caught it, only just
full on the pads and going down, tries to flick it fine, is hit on the pads, they get a leg bye
good length on the off stump, defended off the front foot wide of cover and they manage a quick single
flighted on the off from round the wicket to the right hander, driven through the line to long-off
tossed up on middle, gets outside the line and drives it down to deep midwicket
short on middle and leg, worked away behind square for a single
quicker and much flatter outside off, comes down the track and pushes it to midwicket
short of a length on the off stump and spinning into the left hander, whipped away wide of midwicket
thrown up, lands on a good length on the off stump, drifting into the right hander, defended off the front foot, end of a good over from Nikita
back of a length on middle, guided to point, calls for a single, is sent back
short of a good length outside off, makes room and dabs it wide of point for  a quick run
fullish outside off but he plays back, waiting for it to work it to third man

missed run out, pitched full outside leg, he tried to glance it down fine, is struck on the pads and the ball lands on the leg side, Bopara is halfway down the track when Strauss responds and Bravo fails to score a direct hit at the non-striker's end. He was a gonner had that hit
fullish on middle and off, pushed back to the bowler
on middle and leg, has no problems turning it wide of midwicket for a single
flat and quick on middle, comes down the track to chip it over midwicket, ends up getting a leading edge towards cover
much slower through the air, succeeds in placing it through the leg side for a single
flighted on middle, comes down the track and strikes it wide of long-on, gets a couple for his efforts, some sharp fielding in the deep by Sammy
valiant effort but he wins a boundary, tossed up outside off, sweeps it uppishly just wide of Dwayne Bravo at deep square leg who flings himself to his right to latch onto it but fails to reach
pushed into the leg side off the back foot, he's on 49 now
tossed up on middle and off, dropped into the leg side
almost got there, full on the off stump, driven powerfully but straight to midwicket
slower ball, an offcutter bowled full, chipped into the leg side in the vacant square-leg region, a fine fifty by the England captain
a touch too short on middle, pulled away to fine leg
short of a length on the off stump, tucked away behind square into the gap between fine leg and deep square leg for a couple
slower ball bowled short on the off stump, played with soft hands, dropped short of point for a single
he's given him most of the strike taking singles like these, nudged behind square

unlucky, short of a length outside off, goes for the cut, gets an inside edge wide of short fine, Chanderpaul gives chase, dives towards the boundary ropes and drags it just back in, splendid effort and the camera pans to Pietersen with an intense look writ large on his face
Strauss continues his merry way, bowled short outside off, comes down the track and making room simultaneously, slaps it over mid-off, a good thrash that, for a one-bounce four

one of the flattest sixes you'll ever see, long-on had just been brought in and he sensed an opporunity, the bowler didn;t do a good job there, fed him with a meaty length ball outside off, Strauss came down and dismissed that over long-on
two more, hundred up for England! Fullish on middle, shuffles and tucks it behind short fine for a couple
misfield and they get two more, Baker the culprit, turned away wide of square leg where some substandard fielding allows them to come back for the second
a rare dot ball, good length on the off stump, punched to cover off the back foot
Bopara has a wild swing, rather uncharacteristic of him today, slower ball bowled on a good length outside off, looks to hoick it over midwicket, misses

that's disappeared, one of the biggest sixes today, length ball on the off stump, he gets under it nicely and dispatches it onto the roof over midwicket, picked it up beautifully, most batsmen would have welcomed such a delivery but would probably not have connected it as well

gone, but has the wicket come too late? Failed to pick the slower one, was into the stroke too early and failed to get to the pitch, Pollard held it back just a touch compared to the previous delivery, Bopara tried to swing it over square leg, got the direction wrong, ended up lofting it really high towards fine leg where Miller took a well-judged catch
slower ball bowled short on leg stump, dropped into the leg side
an atrocious delivery, under the circumstances, loosener outside leg stump, given a wide
on the stumps, middle and leg, glanced down to fine leg
off the mark, tucked away into the leg side for a single to keep the strike
full on the off stump, driven through the line towards long-off
fullish on the off stump, pushed back lazily to the bowler
dragged in short on middle, Strauss is down the track and pulls it away towards deep midwicket
short of a good length on the off stump, dropped off the back foot short of cover for a quick single
full on middle and off, walks across to tickle it wide of Baker at short fine who's dived well before the ball has got to him and ends up having to drag himself towards it, comical stuff that
almost chopped it on, short of a length outside off, tries to run it down, gets an under edge on the bounce to the keeper
short of a length on leg stump, tries to turn it fine, is hit on the thighs and they scramble a run
slower ball that Strass fails to pick, ends up in the blockhole but outside off, dug out towards midwicket
short of a length on middle, a bouncer, comes forward and then tries to swat it into the leg side, misses
back of a length on leg stump, pulled away to deep square leg

slower ball bowled on a good length outside off, makes room to smash that over extra cover, gets the inside edge that just manages to escape off stump and evades a diving Ramdin to roll down the fine-leg boundary. That pretty much seals it
full on middle, driven down the ground to long-on
driven back firmly past the bowler, full on middle and Prior drills that down the ground, Pollard runs a fair distance to his right from long-off to dive and cut that off just inside the ropes
short on middle, Prior makes room and chips that in the direction of third man, fals well short and they get a single
full outside of, tries to drive it with a full face, gets a thick outside edge wide of a diving point for a single
slower ball on middle, Prior is into the attemtped slog a little too early, misses, just goes over the stumps
down the leg side, Fidel straying in line there, a run conceded
short of a good length on middle and off, worked away off the back foot wide of midwicket for a single
back of a length outside off, dabbed down to third man for a single
fullish on middle and leg, turned away to deep square leg
short on middle, pulled away to deep midwicket, just one hit away now
edged, deliberately done, just a fraction short outside off, Strauss guides that past the keeper to the third-man boundary to seal a comprehensive win for England.
